I want to thank everyone who helped make this event possible. Opportunities to salute my fellow veterans are very special to me, and I will continue standing up for them in Congress. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/E5Ta3QvWEAg6P3v.jpg

I have personally benefited from hiring veterans, and currently have three on my staff in both Alaska and DC. I strongly encourage my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to considering bringing veterans into their offices.

I am very proud to work with HillVets, & over the years, our partnership has opened doors for countless veterans. Congress benefits from the knowledge & expertise of these battle-tested individuals, and conversely, our veterans learn the skills necessary to excel on Capitol Hill.

This fellowship seeks to increase the number of veterans working on Capitol Hill by providing them with the resources and skills necessary to bridge the gap between military service and legislative work.
That is why I ‚Äì alongside my friend, @RepThompson ‚Äì became the first Member of Congress to support the HillVets Fellowship Program.

When I first came to Washington, DC, veterans comprised about 70% of Congress. Sadly, that number is only around 15% today. When it comes to veterans on staff, that number is even lower ‚Äì less than 3%.

I greatly appreciated the opportunity to address veterans at a recent reception hosted by @HillVets, a vital organization that helps veterans make their way to Capitol Hill. As a veteran myself, I truly believe that more of us should serve and work in Congress.
